Whenthe Vanguard last Sunday came out with the screaming headline "Awo's Son To Run With Yar'Adua," one couldnothelp but be amused. One was amused because politi- clansgenerally believe inimpossibilities. They never believe they could fall until turned downatthe polls. Most of them no doubt are day dreamers. Butthe problem is the June 12 issue. It is one issue that will not go away, no matter how hard its enemies tried. It remains to be seen how those ambitious politi- cians will realise their ambition with June 12 unresolved. It is the stumbling block between Yar'Adua and the West. But it can be removed if Yar' Adua tries to be a better realist than he is now. Butthe problem is the June 12 issue. It is one issue that will not go away, no matter how hard its enemies tried. It remains to be seen how those ambitious politi- cians will realise their ambition with June 12 unresolved. It is the stumbling block between Yar'Adua and the West. But it can be removed if Yar' Adua tries to be a better realist than he is now.

Nevertheless, one's advice to Shehu Musa Yar' Adua, if he is sincere in rebuilding the dam- aged bridge between the north and the west, is to stop chasing shadows. He should seek rap- prochement with the au- thentic Yoruba political leaders. He knows them himself. He should meet them and discuss with them. Nevertheless, one's advice to Shehu Musa Yar' Adua, if he is sincere in rebuilding the dam- aged bridge between the north and the west, is to stop chasing shadows. TheNigerian institutions, groupsand peoplewho have been actively involved in the struggle of the last five years or thereabouts to pull down the wall of military dictator- ship. In the vanguard of this struggleare the human rights groups, the Nigerian stu- dents, academics, the radical wing of the labour unions, particularly the oil workers, a cross section of principled politicians, the Nigerian press, selected members of the bar and bench, notable nationalists as well as thou- sands of ordinary Nigerians - drivers, market women, ar- tisans, area boys, the jobless TheNigerian institutions, groupsand peoplewho have been actively involved in the struggle of the last five years or thereabouts to pull down the wall of military dictator- ship.
